comments.author: Shakeology
comments.content: Thanks for the fantastic recipe, I'm going to give this a whirl over the weekend. Great photos by the way!

comments.author: pj krause
comments.content: Now I know what's for dinner tonight--thanks!

comments.author: Persian
comments.content: Mmm.  Looks yummy.  Hey, I was curious.  You mentioned that almost every culture has its own crispy version.  Do you know if this is also true in Japanese cuisine?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Yep, there is onigiri, where rice is formed into a ball or other shape and grilled, which gives it somewhat of a crispy crust. And there are also Japanese versions of fried rice.

comments.author: Jared Clifford
comments.content: Wow, that looks delicious!!  I love crispy rice so very much!!  I have been trying different ways to brown and crisp rice with a healthy twist!!  Thanks for this one!

comments.author: halleh
comments.content:
hello
i am a  persian . well i enjoy this food too much . and we eat this food with KHORESHT . like korean people  that eat kimchi with other foods . we have too mane khoresht's like 

1- ghorme sabzie
2- gheymeh 
3- badenjan 
4- karafs
and...

if u like to have this khoresht's . i will be happy to send the recipe for every body on this web site .

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Hi Halleh - Thanks for your note; if you want to post some of you favorite khorest recipes as comments here I'm sure everyone would enjoy them, and maybe sometime I can work one up to be a full post on the site (with credit to you of course!).

comments.author: halleh
comments.content:
Hello .
Thank you for your note . i am very excited about it .
i will send you the recipes as soon as i finish  translating them to the english .
